text: Ferenc Deák (16 January 1922 – 18 April 1998) was a Hungarian footballer. He played as a striker for teams like Ferencváros and Budapesti Dózsa. With over 795 goals in official matches scored during his career, the bulk of which came during World War II, Deák is the seventh top goalscorer of all time. ==Honours== ===Individual=== * Hungarian Football Federation Player of the Year: 1946 * Seasonwise World Top Scorer (3): 1945-46, 1946-47, 1948-49Seasonwise World Top Scorer. rsssf.com * Hungarian League Top Scorer (3): 1946, 1947, 1949 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1922 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Footballers from Budapest Category:Association football forwards
title: Ferenc Deák (footballer)
